Articles.Content:
59 minutes ago, Milvus said:

I had 104 mod installe, and some bug, i have disistalled kerbal and all the mod, and have reistalle it. i have deleted some mod (blue dogs and others) because now i have the dlc. and i have no problem.
the only solution reistall it one at atime

Its unlikely that bluedog or part mods cause the issue. Can you give me a screenshot of your game data folder? It might help me. I have all mods up to date. A reinstall will probably not work. Personally I split my data folder into 2 parts. I test the mods 50/50. 25/25. 12/13 etc. It's the fastest way to find conflicts. @Sigma88 does it matter if Kopernicus is installed during an existing save game or are new save games recommended?
I have done some tests now and I cannot even recreate the issue in a new save game. Everything working fine.

2 hours ago, dave1904 said:

does it matter if Kopernicus is installed during an existing save game or are new save games recommended

it depends on the save, I would always recommend starting fresh, expecially if you are debugging, however there are some conditions under which you might be able to put kopernicus on an old save and make it work

I'm trying to install KSRSS, but I'm still a bit confused as to how planet packs and Kopernicus are installed.When installing a planet pack, people tell me to copy and paste a new KSP into a new directory. How, why, and what?

Edited February 25, 2020 by alberro+

51 minutes ago, alberro+ said:

I'm trying to install KSRSS, but I'm still a bit confused as to how planet packs and Kopernicus are installed.When installing a planet pack, people tell me to copy and paste a new KSP into a new directory. How, why, and what?

When you leave your ksp in your steam folder you risk the game auto-updating, wich in the case of kopernicus always 'breaks' your game since kopernicus is version locked. You can prevent that auto-updating by moving the ksp folder out of the steam folder.

2 hours ago, Wackenhut said:

When you leave your ksp in your steam folder you risk the game auto-updating, wich in the case of kopernicus always 'breaks' your game since kopernicus is version locked. You can prevent that auto-updating by moving the ksp folder out of the steam folder.

Yeah, but where do I move it?

13 minutes ago, alberro+ said:

Yeah, but where do I move it?

Literally anywhere else on your computer other than the steam folder. Copy, not move.

2 hours ago, alberro+ said:

Yeah, but where do I move it?

As Leatherneck said, copy the KSP folder from your Steam folder and place it anywhere convenient.  Leave a pristine copy in your Steam folder - this will always get the updates without affecting your modded KSP folder.

Personally, I copy each new version to a folder I call KSPStuff.  I then make a copy of THAT copy and use it for my modded games, and rename the folder to, forex: KSP 1.8.1 - JNSQ, or KSP 1.7.0 - GPP. 

I have approximately 35 distinct copies of KSP on my computer (some modded, some bone stock), every single one completely playable and safe from Steam's auto-update feature.

Edited February 26, 2020 by MaxxQ

What is the latest status on the update for 1.9.0?

Is it possible to say anything about an ETA for an update?

Folks, it's not against any rules to ask about mod updates, as long as it's done politely and without undue repetitiveness. And if someone does ask, that does not give others the right to rude and nasty to that person. If you believe a post is a problem, please just hit the report button on it and let the moderators deal with it.

1 hour ago, EasyAce said:

What is the latest status on the update for 1.9.0?

Is it possible to say anything about an ETA for an update?

Working on it, no ETA yet

could be one week or one month, hard to tell

56 minutes ago, Sigma88 said:

Working on it, no ETA yet

could be one week or one month, hard to tell

Thanks!

5 minutes ago, EasyAce said:

Thanks! 

correction, there will be no update for 1.9.0

 

 

now working on 1.9.1 compatibility

37 minutes ago, Sigma88 said:

correction, there will be no update for 1.9.0

 

 

now working on 1.9.1 compatibility

My only hope is the 1.9.1 update makes it easier for you authors, not harder lol

4 hours ago, Sigma88 said:

correction, there will be no update for 1.9.0

 

 

now working on 1.9.1 compatibility

Will 1.9.1 compatible kopernicus also be compatible with 1.9.0 or not?

1 minute ago, Mlgisawsome02 said:

Will 1.9.1 compatible kopernicus also be compatible with 1.9.0 or not?

Probably not. Why would you keep 1.9.0 anyway?

1 minute ago, infinite_monkey said:

Probably not. Why would you keep 1.9.0 anyway?

i just installed a bunch of mods on a non steam directory so i dont want to have to go back to the steam version, make a copy of that, and then have to get the mod

1 hour ago, Mlgisawsome02 said:

Will 1.9.1 compatible kopernicus also be compatible with 1.9.0 or not?

No, Kopernicus is version locked.  For instance, Kopernicus 1.8.1-1 will work only with KSP 1.8.1 and no other.  Since we're already up to KSP 1.9.1, it's possible Kopernicus could skip 1.9.0 entirely.  It's happened before.

14 minutes ago, OhioBob said:

No, Kopernicus is version locked.  For instance, Kopernicus 1.8.1-1 will work only with KSP 1.8.1 and no other.  Since we're already up to KSP 1.9.1, it's possible Kopernicus could skip 1.9.0 entirely.  It's happened before.

That sucks I was planning to get it on 1.9.0 since I already made a new save on this and I can't update it now

23 minutes ago, Mlgisawsome02 said:

That sucks I was planning to get it on 1.9.0 since I already made a new save on this and I can't update it now

You should be able to move your save from 1.9.0 to 1.9.1.  Just drag the folder from one installation to the other.

On 2/27/2020 at 4:46 PM, Sigma88 said:

now working on 1.9.1 compatibility

This is very exciting, and thank-you for all the hard work.

I honestly don't know how you guys keep up with all the version changes in KSP.  Hopefully KSP2 has a more static and standardized mod path that lets modders create and not hobble them with constant compatibility efforts.

3 hours ago, Chilkoot said:

Hopefully KSP2 has a more static and standardized mod path that lets modders create and not hobble them with constant compatibility efforts.

Well, I hope Kopernicus isn't needed anymore for KSP2

On 2/25/2020 at 5:03 AM, dok_377 said:

Is Kopernicus still doesn't work well with the stock scattering system (trees and other stuff)? I'm getting some significant dips in performance just flying on Kerbin (as low as 25 fps on 100 part craft) when scattering is enabled. The game behaves normally when I either remove Kopernicus or disable the scattering system completely.

Me as well.

Do you by chance have a Radeon Graphics card?  Just checking.
